meanings.definition: A positively charged particle with the same mass as an electron.
meanings.sent1: Scientists study positrons to understand their positive charge.
meanings.sent2: The lab detected positrons in the experiment.
meanings.sent3: The positrons in the atom party always bring good vibes.
meanings.sent4: Like tiny positive fairies, positrons danced around the nucleus.
meanings.sent5: The classroom model vividly showed how positrons differ from electrons.

meanings.definition: Positrons are emitted by certain radioactive substances.
meanings.sent1: The radiation contained positrons that were released into the air.
meanings.sent2: The detector picked up the presence of positrons in the sample.
meanings.sent3: The radioactive material whispered to the positrons, 'Time to shine!'
meanings.sent4: In the radioactive decay, positrons burst forth like shooting stars.
meanings.sent5: The laboratory was filled with the faint glow of emitted positrons.
